domainElements.description:
A bare object or morphism is one that is not constructed by categorical operators
and has no data.

To create a new action, select bare objects or morphisms and lastly a named object
or morphism that uses all the selected elements, then a new action may be created.

All actions from all diagrams in the userâ€™s session are available for the user
depending on the userâ€™s selection of elements.Â  An action appears on the toolbar
for the user to invoke when the pattern of the actionâ€™s selected elements, minus
the named element, is matched.

When activated, a form shows the selected items and aspects of the contemplated
action.Â  A list of all bare objects and morphisms used by the named element and not
in the selected list are shown.Â  These bare elements must be used in the action.

A list of all diagrams that must be referenced is shown.Â  If an action is used in a
diagram, these reference diagrams are added as references in that diagram.

Objects and morphisms in the select list are said to be generalized for the action.
A conflict occurs if a selected object is attached to a morphism that has data as that
specific data cannot be generalized.
